meanings.definition: To tie together the hands and feet of a person or animal
meanings.sent1: The cowboy had to hogtie the calf to keep it still for the examination.
meanings.sent2: The rancher used a rope to hogtie the escaped horse and bring it back to the stable.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hogtie a squirrel would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Her fear hogtied her, preventing her from taking any action.
meanings.sent5: The magician could hogtie a volunteer in seconds, leaving the audience amazed.

meanings.definition: A method of restraining someone by tying their hands and feet together
meanings.sent1: The criminal used a hogtie to keep the victim from escaping.
meanings.sent2: The detective found marks on the ground indicating a struggle and a hogtie.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain joked about using a hogtie to keep his crew in line.
meanings.sent4: The ancient warriors used a hogtie to secure their prisoners during battles.
meanings.sent5: The escape artist could easily break free from any hogtie, impressing the audience.
